title: What are the advantages of computers? - Quora

response.answer_text: In addition to the other excellent answers, I’d like to add this: Computers are very good at doing things that humans are generally pretty crummy at. Here’s a simple example. The next time you go on a major shopping trip, once you get home, go through the receipt and add all the prices together, then calculate the tax. Some people are good at that sort of thing. But most people aren’t. I majored in Math in college and graduated summa cum laude, but I hate trying to add up a long list of numbers. I’ll get it wrong more often than not. Way more often. But a good computer, properly programmed, eats that stuff like candy. Computers do that without breaking a sweat. Without an error. Ever. And that just a simple task for computers. One of the first “super apps” was a spreadsheet. VisiCalc was introduced for the Apple II back in 1979, Before that, there were spreadsheet applications on mainframe computers. Prior to that, there were document creation programs. The first available on a “home computer” was Electric Pencil for the Altair in 1976. Many people today have never experienced the torture of using a typewriter for writing a memo, or a school paper, or even a letter. Some may have used a typewriter with a built-in erase function. I was lucky enough to have one of those when I started college in 1980. In addition to a ribbon containing the black for the letters, it also included a white ribbon that would cover a mistyped letter. Or two, maybe. But see a misspelled word a few lines up? Your choice is to either re-type the whole page or leave the typo. Want to move a paragraph around, maybe from one page to another page? You have to re-type the “from” page and the “to” page, and likely all the pages in between. I really hated writing papers for school. And I was actually pretty good at the composition part, but getting a clean copy was infuriating. Word processors changed all that. You can make mistakes and easily fix them. You can easily move things around to your heart’s content. And later word processors started to help you catch and fix errors. You can also get a computer to do boring tasks that a human would fail at. Count all the letters used in a 400+ page book? If that book is in e-form, a program can do that easily, and quickly. A human? Not so much. Ok, maybe no one cares about how many letters are in a book. But the same idea is very useful in all sorts of ways.
